page.title: 18Local History in Mowsley.
page.content: The H.family have lived in Mowsley for over 300 years.3 generations have been blacksmiths;the family also farmed locally.Mr.H.is 64 and was born in Mowsley and has lived here always. He can remember when the village was completely gated and self sufficent. There was a general store,haberdasher, butcher,slaughter house,wheelwright and a carpenter. There was no electricity until the 1940's,& 3 parish pumps served the village. Leaving Mowsley school at 14,(the playground was the street) Mr.H.farmed in Laughton for 12/6 a week(7.00-5.30 every day).Children going on to Market Harborough Grammar School were given lifts on the farmers'{milk floats}to Theddingworth & then walked. Every house had{farming}connections, keeping a pig,hens & ducks.Mowsley had about 42 shire & milk{horses.
